verses.verse: Now <WG1161> faith<WG4102> is<WG2076> assurance<WG5287> of things hoped for<WG1679>, a conviction<WG1650> of things<WG4229> not<WG3756> seen<WG991>.
For1063, 1722 therein<WG3778> the elders<WG4245> had witness borne to them<WG3140>.

By faith<WG4102> we understand<WG3539> that<WG2675> the worlds<WG165> have been framed<WG2675> by the word<WG4487> of God<WG2316>, so that<WG1519> what is seen<WG991> hath<WG1096> not<WG3361> been made<WG1096> out of<WG1537> things which appear<WG5316>.

By faith<WG4102> Abel<WG6> offered<WG4374> unto God<WG2316> a more excellent<WG4119> sacrifice<WG2378> than<WG3844> Cain<WG2535>, through<WG1223> which<WG3739> he had witness<WG3140> borne to him that he was<WG1511> righteous<WG1342>, God<WG2316> bearing witness<WG3140> in respect of<WG1909> his<WG846> gifts<WG1435>: and<WG2532> through<WG1223> it<WG846> he being dead<WG599> yet<WG2089> speaketh<WG2980>.

By faith<WG4102> Enoch<WG1802> was translated<WG3346> that<WG3361> he should<WG1492> not<WG3361> see<WG1492> death<WG2288>; and<WG2532> he was<WG2147> not<WG3756> found<WG2147>, because<WG1360> God<WG2316> translated<WG3346> him<WG846>: for<WG1063> he hath had witness<WG3140> borne to him that before<WG4253> his<WG846> translation<WG3331> he had been well-pleasing<WG2100> unto God<WG2316>:

And <WG1161> without<WG5565> faith<WG4102> it is impossible<WG102> to be well-pleasing<WG2100> unto him<WG1063>; for he that cometh<WG4334> to God<WG2316> must<WG1163> believe<WG4100> that<WG3754> he is<WG2076>, and<WG2532> that he is<WG1096> a rewarder<WG3406> of them that seek<WG1567> after him<WG846>.

By faith<WG4102> Noah<WG3575>, being warned of God<WG5537> concerning<WG4012> things<WG991> not<WG3369> seen<WG991> as yet<WG3369>, moved with godly fear<WG2125>, prepared<WG2680> an ark<WG2787> to<WG1519> the saving<WG4991> of<WG3624> his<WG846> house<WG3624>; through<WG1223> which<WG3739> he condemned<WG2632> the world<WG2889>, and<WG2532> became<WG1096> heir<WG2818> of the righteousness<WG1343> which is according<WG2596> to faith<WG4102>.

By faith<WG4102> Abraham<WG11>, when he was called<WG2564>, obeyed<WG5219> to go out<WG1831> unto<WG1519> a place<WG5117> which<WG3739> he was to<WG3195> receive<WG2983> for<WG1519> an inheritance<WG2817>; and<WG2532> he went out<WG1831>, not<WG3361> knowing<WG1987> whither<WG4226> he went<WG2064>.

By faith<WG4102> he became a sojourner<WG3939> in<WG1519> the land<WG1093> of promise<WG1860>, as<WG5613> in a land<WG245> not his own<WG2730>, dwelling in<WG1722> tents<WG4633>, with<WG3326> Isaac<WG2464> and<WG2532> Jacob<WG2384>, the heirs with him<WG4789> of the same<WG846> promise<WG1860>:
for <WG1063> he looked for<WG1551> the city<WG4172> which hath<WG2192> the foundations<WG2310>, whose<WG3739> builder<WG5079> and<WG2532> maker<WG1217> is God<WG2316>.

By faith<WG4102> even<WG2532> Sarah<WG4564> herself<WG846> received<WG2983> power<WG1411> to<WG1519> conceive<WG2602> seed<WG4690> when she was past3844, 2540 age<WG2244>, since<WG1893> she counted<WG2233> him<WG1861> faithful<WG4103> who had promised<WG1861>:

wherefore <WG1352> also there sprang<WG1080> of<WG575> one<WG1520>, and<WG2532> him<WG5023> as<WG2531> good as dead<WG3499>, so many as<WG2531> the stars<WG798> of heaven in multitude<WG4128>, and<WG2532> as<WG5616> the<WG5491> sand<WG285>, which is<WG3588> by<WG3844> the<WG2281> sea-shore<WG5491>, innumerable<WG382>.

These <WG3778> all<WG3956> died<WG599> in<WG2596> faith<WG4102>, not<WG3361> having received<WG2983> the promises<WG1860>, but<WG235> having seen<WG1492> them<WG846> and<WG2532> greeted<WG782> them from afar<WG4207>, and<WG2532> having confessed<WG3670> that<WG3754> they were<WG1526> strangers<WG3581> and<WG2532> pilgrims<WG3927> on<WG1909> the earth<WG1093>.
For <WG1063> they that say<WG3004> such things<WG5108> make it manifest<WG1718> that<WG3754> they are seeking<WG1934> after a country of their own<WG3968>.

And <WG2532> if<WG1487> indeed<WG3303> they had been mindful<WG3421> of that<WG1565> country from<WG575> which<WG3739> they went out<WG1831>, they would have had2192, Leviticus2 opportunity<WG2540> to return<WG344>.

But <WG1161> now<WG3570> they desire<WG3713> a better<WG2909> country<WG5124>, that is<WG2076>, a heavenly<WG2032>: wherefore<WG1352> God<WG2316> is<WG1870> not<WG3756> ashamed<WG1870> of them<WG846>, to be called<WG1941> their<WG846> God<WG2316>; for<WG1063> he hath prepared<WG2090> for them<WG846> a city<WG4172>.

By faith<WG4102> Abraham<WG11>, being tried<WG3985>, offered up<WG4374> Isaac<WG2464>: yea<WG2532>, he that had gladly received<WG324> the promises<WG1860> was offering up<WG4374> his only begotten son<WG3439>;
even he to<WG4314> whom<WG3739> it was said<WG2980>, <WG3754> In<WG1722> Isaac<WG2464> shall<WG2564> thy<WG4671> seed<WG4690> be called<WG2564>:

accounting <WG3049> that<WG3754> God<WG2316> is able<WG1415> to raise<WG1453> up<WG1453>, even<WG2532> from<WG1537> the dead<WG3498>; from whence<WG3606> he did also<WG2532> in<WG1722> a figure<WG3850> receive<WG2865> him back<WG846>.
By faith<WG4102> Isaac<WG2464> blessed<WG2127> Jacob<WG2384> and<WG2532> Esau<WG2269>, even concerning<WG4012> things to come<WG3195>.

By faith<WG4102> Jacob<WG2384>, when he was dying<WG599>, blessed<WG2127> each<WG1538> of the sons<WG5207> of Joseph<WG2501>; and<WG2532> worshipped<WG4352>, leaning upon<WG1909> the top<WG206> of<WG4464> his<WG846> staff<WG4464>.

By faith<WG4102> Joseph<WG2501>, when his end<WG5053> was nigh<WG3421>, made mention of<WG4012> the departure<WG1841> of the children<WG5207> of Israel<WG2474>; and<WG2532> gave commandment<WG1781> concerning<WG4012> his<WG846> bones<WG3747>.

By faith<WG4102> Moses<WG3475>, when he was born<WG1080>, was hid<WG2928> three months<WG5150> by<WG5259> his<WG846> parents<WG3962>, because<WG1360> they saw<WG1492> he was a goodly<WG791> child<WG3813>; and<WG2532> they were<WG5399> not<WG3756> afraid<WG5399> of<WG1297> the king<WG935>'s commandment<WG1297>.
By faith<WG4102> Moses<WG3475>, when he was grown<WG1096> up<WG3173>, refused<WG720> to be called<WG3004> the son<WG5207> of<WG2364> Pharaoh<WG5328>'s daughter<WG2364>;
choosing <WG138> rather<WG3123> to share ill treatment with<WG4778> the people<WG2992> of God<WG2316>, than<WG2228> to enjoy<WG2192> the pleasures<WG619> of sin<WG266> for a season<WG4340>;

accounting <WG2233> the reproach<WG3680> of Christ<WG5547> greater<WG3173> riches<WG4149> than the treasures<WG2344> of<WG1722> Egypt<WG125>: for<WG1063> he looked<WG578> unto<WG1519> the recompense of reward<WG3405>.

By faith<WG4102> he forsook<WG2641> Egypt<WG125>, not<WG3361> fearing<WG5399> the wrath<WG2372> of the king<WG935>: for<WG1063> he endured<WG2594>, as<WG5613> seeing<WG3708> him who is invisible<WG517>.

By faith<WG4102> he kept<WG4160> the passover<WG3957>, and<WG2532> the sprinkling<WG4378> of the blood<WG2443>, that the destroyer<WG3645> of the firstborn<WG4416> should not<WG3361> touch<WG2345> them<WG846>.

By faith<WG4102> they passed through<WG1224> the<WG2281> Red<WG2063> sea<WG2281> as<WG5613> by<WG1223> dry<WG3584> land<WG3739>: which the Egyptians<WG124> assaying<WG3984> to do<WG2983> were swallowed up<WG2666>.
By faith<WG4102> the walls<WG5038> of Jericho<WG2410> fell down<WG4098>, after they had been compassed<WG2944> about<WG1909> for seven<WG2033> days<WG2250>.
By faith<WG4102> Rahab<WG4460> the harlot<WG4204> perished<WG4881> not<WG3756> with<WG4881> them that were disobedient<WG544>, having received<WG1209> the spies<WG2685> with<WG3326> peace<WG1515>.

And <WG2532> what<WG5101> shall I<WG3004> more<WG2089> say<WG3004>? for<WG1063> the time<WG5550> will fail<WG1952> me<WG3165> if I tell<WG1334> of<WG4012> Gideon<WG1066>, Barak<WG913>, Samson<WG4546>, Jephthah<WG2422>; of David<WG1138> and<WG2532> Samuel<WG4545> and<WG2532> the prophets<WG4396>:

quenched <WG4570> the power<WG1411> of fire<WG4442>, escaped<WG5343> the edge<WG4750> of the sword<WG3162>, from<WG575> weakness<WG769> were made strong<WG1743>, waxed<WG1096> mighty<WG2478> in<WG1722> war<WG4171>, turned to flight<WG2827> armies<WG3925> of aliens<WG245>.

Women <WG1135> received<WG2983> their<WG846> dead<WG3498> by<WG1537> a resurrection<WG386>: and<WG1161> others<WG243> were tortured<WG5178>, not<WG3756> accepting<WG4327> their deliverance<WG629>; that<WG2443> they might obtain<WG5177> a better<WG2909> resurrection<WG386>:
and <WG1161> others<WG2087> had<WG2983> trial<WG3984> of<WG1701> mockings<WG1701> and<WG2532> scourgings<WG3148>, yea<WG2089>, moreover<WG1161> of bonds<WG1199> and<WG2532> imprisonment<WG5438>:

they were stoned<WG3034>, they were sawn asunder<WG4249>, they were tempted<WG3985>, they were slain<WG1722> with<WG1722> the sword<WG3162>: they went about<WG4022> in<WG1722> sheepskins<WG3374>, in1722, 122 goatskins<WG1192>; being destitute<WG5302>, afflicted<WG2346>, ill-treated<WG2558>

(of whom<WG3739> the world<WG2889> was<WG2258> not<WG3756> worthy<WG514>), wandering<WG4105> in<WG1722> deserts<WG2047> and<WG2532> mountains<WG3735> and<WG2532> caves<WG4693>, and<WG2532> the holes<WG3692> of the earth<WG1093>.
